author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Strong Typhoon Soudelor takes aim at Taiwan, China - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Strong Typhoon Soudelor takes aim at Taiwan, China
Termed as world’s most powerful storm of the year ‘Typhoon Soudelor’, though no longer classified as super typhoon, is taking direct aim at Taiwan and China.
The storm is likely to hit Taiwan early Saturday morning local time, before moving on to mainland China on Saturday night.
The storm’s wind speed decreased to 115 miles per hour on Wednesday from 180 miles per hour, which made it the strongest typhoon so far this year.
However, the storm is forecast to strengthen again before making landfall and will likely be the equivalent of a Category 3 or Category 4 hurricane when it hits Taiwan.
Notably, a typhoon becomes a super typhoon when it has winds equal to or greater than 150 mph.
